---
title: "Case Study: Ovarian Cancer Survival Dataset"
output: html_notebook
---

```{r libraries, setup}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(survival)
library(survminer)
```

Read in the dataset.

```{r}
d <- survival::ovarian
write.table(d, file = "../data/ovarian-cancer-survival.csv", sep=",", quote=FALSE, row.names=FALSE)
```

Adjust the coding of the covariates.

```{r}
d <- d %>% mutate(fustat = as.factor(fustat), 
                  resid.ds = as.factor(resid.ds), 
                  rx = as.factor(rx), 
                  ecog.ps = as.factor(ecog.ps))
summary(d)
```

```{r}
p <- ggplot(d) + geom_histogram(aes(x = futime), bins = 30) + theme_minimal() + ylab("Count")
print(p)
ggsave(p, filename = "../img/cs-ovarian-futime.png", height=3, width=3, units="in", dpi=300)

p <- ggplot(d) + geom_bar(aes(x = fustat)) + theme_minimal() + ylab("Count")
print(p)
```
